greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 2^a(n) is the highest power of 2 dividing A214551(n).
comment: This is the 2-adic valuation of A214551.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: A214551[m_] := Nest[f, {1, 1, 1}, m]; IntegerExponent[A214551[200], 2] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 28 2017 *)
program: (MAGMA) m:=100; A214551:=[i le 2 select 1 else (Self(i)+Self(i-2)) div Gcd(Self(i),Self(i-2)): i in [0..m]]; [Valuation(A214551[n],2): n in [1..m+1]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Aug 05 2013
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 04 2013
